summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by a U.S. Magistrate Judge authorizing the forensic review of 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties. The devices were seized during his arrest and from searches of his New York residence and private island. The warrant authorizes a search for evidence related to sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement, and conspiracy.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the investigation. Electronic devices were seized from his person and his residences. The warrant seeks evidence of his co-conspirators and victims.

persons.name: Sarah Kellen
persons.context: Specifically named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein. The warrant authorizes a search for evidence concerning her identity, location, and communications.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Specifically named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein. The warrant authorizes a search for evidence concerning her identity, location, and communications.

persons.name: Gabriel W. Gorenstein
persons.context: The judge who signed and issued the search and seizure warrant on June 26, 2020.

connections.description: The warrant identifies Kellen as a co-conspirator of Epstein in the subject offenses.
The warrant identifies Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Epstein in the subject offenses.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI. Two electronic devices (an iPad and iPhone) were seized from his person during this arrest.

events.title: Search of 9 East 71st Street, New York
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's New York City residence, resulting in the seizure of 33 electronic devices from various locations within the multi-story mansion.

events.title: Search of Little Saint James, USVI
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, resulting in the seizure of 27 electronic devices from the main residence, pool house, cabanas, beach house, sheds, and maintenance office.

events.title: Warrant Issued for Device Review
events.description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein issued this search warrant authorizing the forensic review of the 62 seized devices for evidence of specified crimes.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Epstein's New York residence)
Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands (Epstein's private island)
keyFacts: The warrant authorizes the search of 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein: 2 from his person at arrest, 33 from his New York mansion, and 27 from his private island.
The warrant specifically names Sarah Kellen and Ghislaine Maxwell as co-conspirators of Jeffrey Epstein, authorizing a search for evidence concerning their identity, location, and communications.

The search is for evidence of crimes including sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 1591), transportation of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 2422), enticement to travel (18 U.S.C. ยง 2423), and conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371).

The warrant authorizes a search for specific categories of evidence, including communications among co-conspirators, financial records, travel documents, and photographs of victims or suggestive images of teenage girls.
The document reveals the extensive scale of the digital evidence collection, with devices found hidden in various locations (e.g., under sinks, in suitcases, in shoeboxes) across multiple properties.
